review_blob: Pours from 12oz bottle slightly hazy golden with a large foamy white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of piney, citrus hops, pale malt and a bit of a buttery note. Flavour was of some lemon, dry pale malt, some tropical fruit. Decent, but not so close as say OB Pinner or GD Lasso.

Poured from 12oz bottle a copper, a bit hazy, big foamy white head and lots of lacing on the glass. Aroma of dank, with a fruit forward mix of pine, oranges, pineapple, mango with a bit of pink bubblegum in the back and caramel malt. Flavour had a toasted malt character that evolves swiftly into a bitter earthy, resiny hop finish with a earthy field grass touch. Pleasantly suprised, would recommend. Boston Beer Company comes back on this one.

Poured from 12 oz bottle a crystal clear light amber with a frothy white head. Aroma of cereal malts, floral notes, oranges, and pineapple. Flavour is dry malt base, some hop bitterness, and some light fruit esters. Also can taste brown sugary maltiness with bits of earth and citrus. Medium body and low carbonation. Middle of the road, nothing special.

Pours from pint can a hazy golden with a decent off-white head that settles to a thick ring and film, leaving some hanging, soapy lace. Aroma of citrus, pineapple, mango, pine, melon, and other tropical fruits. Flavour of dry citrus rind, apricot, yellow grapefruit skins, wet toast, grassy hops. Decent DIPA, but not a knock out.

Poured from bomber an orange and amber hue, forming a light beige craggy head of foam. Aroma of grass, malts, slight floral hints along with some raisin like clues. Flavour much of the same, reminds me more of a dubbel. Ok, but not memorable.

Poured a nice straw color from bomber, aroma immediate of field grass, hops, tropical and citrus fruits. Formed decent craggley head of foam. Flavour was crisp and bitter, hops well balanced with lightly malted esters. Another well done by Foothills.
beer_name: Foothills IPA of the Month: March 2015 (Murphy)

review_blob: Poured from bomber a deep, somewhat coppery reddish brown with a thick and frothy pale tan head. Aroma of prickley pines, earthy hops, caramel, bread, and some spices and black pepper. Flavour was of malts with lots of grains, toast and a light dirty citrus hoppiness. Solid red ale. Thanks Ed (Doughboy)

Pours from 12 oz bottle a clear copper golden with a small white head. Aroma is quite resinous hop-heavy, with lots of sweet caramel malt back. Flavour of herbal hops, tropical floral notes, citrus fruit, caramel, toasted grains, sweet malt, and wet field grass. Overall decent DIPA, would drink again, but not super memorable. Would recommend.

Pours from 12 oz bottle a clear amber with rising fizzy white head. Aroma is dank, pine, and grassy hops, citrus fruit, biscuit and cracker malts, and faint caramel. Flavour forward of grapefruit, herbal, and pine hops with pear esters and cracker malt. Eh....

Poured from 12 oz can a hazy yellow color, with a big, off-white head. Nice floral hop aroma up front, with some white bread, citrus, and rye. Flavour was fuller bodied with average to slightly stronger carbonation and a lingering spicey finish with notes of wet bread, bread crusts, citrus, orange and yellow grapefruit along with a touch of rye spice. Pleasant, tasty beer. Recommended.

Pours from 12 oz can a medium golden forming a small white head of foam. Lacing evident. Aroma of grass, malts, slight floral arrangements with some earthen leaves. Flavour of tropical fruits, field grass, malty biscuits and hop leaf. Decent enough, not bad.

Poured from 12 oz can a nice medium amber hue, forming thin beige head of foam. Aroma was knock out, guava fruits, mangoes, wet earthen field grass, and a small bit of pepper. Flavour lovely malted rye, nice bittering hops, lemon rinds, with a middle level biscuit at the end. Phenomenal beer, exceptional.

From tap, Beer Army Outpost, medium amber and hazy. Formed decent two finger head of light beige cragley foam. Aroma of toasted biscuit malts, grassy and floral hops, lemon zest, and light funk. Flavour of bitter pine, resin, light grapefruit backed by light grains.

Poured from bomber a medium deep orange, forming light beige head of foam. Aroma of hops, malts, and wet field grass. Flavour more malt oriented, some hop bitterness, softly carbonated. Decent DIPA, however not memorable.

On tap at Beer Army Outpost, poured a clear gold with a small and thin white head. Aromas of straw, grapefruit, field grass, light earthiness and light pine. Flavour was of pine, grapefruit, mango, orange, malt, resinous. Very clean and crisp, rock solid sessioner.

Pours from 12 o bottle a clear dark reddish copper with a very thin, off white head. Aroma malt forward, sweet, grassy, lightly vegital hop matter, tangerine, resin and lightly dank. Some dried fruit character and floral notes. Flavour of toffee, mango. grapefruit, apricot, tea leaf and orange are tamed by a lingering finish of mint, evergreen resin with wet Irish field grass. Superb beer, recommend.

Poured from 12 oz bottle a hue of amber and orange, fair head and lacing. Aroma of clove, spruce, grapefruit, wet earthen field grass, milk chocolate, and lightly toasted grains. Flavour of big caramel, sweet, sticky malt, pine resins, soft citrus and spicy hops. Body is medium with a creamy, bubbly carbonation. Decent enough I suppose, recommended.

Pours a dark amber color with an off white head and some lacing. Aroma of strong rye and spices with an equally strong hop presence. Flavour of peppery rye, assertive citrusy bitterness, turning more of a herbal citrus pithy bitterness towards the finish. Superior beer, my fave from SN.

Pours a beautiful, hazy yellow, gold with a thin, white head and great lacing. Aroma of ripened bananas, buttered biscuits, lemon & tangerines. Flavour was of flowers with notes of banana, clove, yeast, nuts, grass hay, honey, some light caramel notes. Overall decent, drinkable beer.

Poured from 12 oz bottle a light golden, somewhat hay color, forming small off white head of foam. Aroma of a little field grass and pine. Biscuity, crackery pale malt sweetness. Flavour was balanced with toasted malts, caramel, fresh lemons, oranges, more topical notes,and a hay like tone. Reminds me of Foothills July IPA. Forward thinking in style and flavour, recommended.

Poured from 12 oz can a hazy straw color, forming decent white head of foam, Aroma of grapefruit and orange citrus, grass, hay, and pale malts. Flavour of dankness, pine, grass, mixing into biscuit, bread, slight caramel, finishing with some honey, orange, and lemon notes. Overall decent, drinkable IPA beer.

Pours from 12 oz bottle a light clear copper-amber color with a finger of frothy white, craggley head. Aroma of some light prickly rye, some malt, some tropical fruits, floral & grassy hops, and some sweet tones. Flavour of bready pale malts, fruity and floral hops, with a spicy rye in the finish. Enjoyable beer !
beer_name: Harpoon 100 Barrel Series #37 - Rich & Dans Rye IPA

review_blob: Poured from bomber a medium golden forming a thin white head of foam. Aroma of hops, herbs, malted goodness, and of course faint green tea. Flavour much of the same, tea comes across lightly. Very drinkable beer and enjoyable. Recommended.
beer_name: Baird / Ishii / Stone Japanese Green Tea IPA 10.1% (2015)

review_blob: Poured from tap a clear golden hue forming an off white head of foam. Aroma up front with tropical fruits, hops, field grass and malts. Flavour very much the same, with mango and papaya coming through, excellent beer.

Pours from tap a deep brown with a tan head. Aroma has some qualities of a pilsener, a grassy, malty aroma. Also a faint hint of cherries. Flavour was of cherries, yogurt, sour, and vinegar. Mouth fell carbonated with a tart finish. Ordinary, I guess.

Pours from 12 oz bottle a nice copper color with a small white head. Aroma of crystal and caramel malt, hops, citrus, pine, and spruce. Flavour of earthy hops, biscuity malts, floral and bitter rindy citrusy (lemon peel) hops with very light pine. No wow factor here.

Poured from 12 oz bottle a medium deep copper color, forming a white head of foam. Aroma of hops, herbs, malted goodness, and Irish field grass. Flavour much of the same, with some slight tropical fruits, medium mouth feel and finishes both malty and bitter.

Poured from 12 oz can a reddish brown, with a thin off white head of foam. Aroma of yeasty malt aroma, balancing hops, a nice bready character. Flavour was of caramel, toffee, dark chocolate, light biscuit, cocoa nibs and effervescent esters. Decent enough.

Pours from bomber a clear amber with a small white head that dissipates fairly quickly leaving a ring of foam and decent lacing. Aroma of Belgian yeast, citrus, pine, sweet malts, banana, pepper and cloves, spicy hops, and candied fruits. Flavour of grapefruit, lemon zest, orange zest, orange rind, clove, pepper, bubblegum, pine, floral, light honey, light banana, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of pine bitterness on the finish. Good stuff....

Poured from 12 oz bottle a brilliant crystal, clear pale golden amber forming decent off white head of foam. Aroma of kosh mango, a bit of pineapple, malts, light pine and stronger field grasses. Flavour much of the same, having a light, pleasant, bitterness. Decent enough, looking forward to summer time sessioning.

Pours (from growler) a near clear amber with very large khaki head and very sticky lacing. Aroma of a pretty good amount of citrus hops with a bit of pine and resin. Flavour of floral and earthy up front with some dry piny flavor and a decent amount of bitterness that lingers through to the finish. Comes across with a syrupy mouthfeel.

Pours from 12 oz bottle a lightly hazed, deep yellow body with an inch of dissipating, white foam. Aroma is definitely grapefruit with a decent malty backbone. Flavour of grapefruit upfront, lots of citrus fruits following, some spice, sweet malt balance and minor lingering bitterness. Decent.

Poured from 12 oz bottle a hazy orange, forming decent size off white craggley head of foam. Aroma of tropical fruits like mango and papaya, dense Scottish field grass, particular dankish hop with a hint of pine resins, with a toasty malt character. Flavour is very lemon dominated with more subtle notes of hops, caramel, hay, biscuit, and pine resins. This beer is ahead of its time, tremendous.

12oz bottle pours a clear golden with a large white head. Aroma of breads, pine, green grass and something skunky. Flavour is sweet, malty, bread, some pine hops, with a clean, light bitterness. Overall decent.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Hoppy Lager

review_blob: Pours from 12oz bottle a cloudy golden orange with fine sediment that gives good white head. Aroma of strong resinous hops, big pine, citrus oils, tropical fruit, toasted malt, Scottish field grass and light caramel. Flavour of tropical fruits like mango and pineapple, pine resins, hop goodness, pine needles with obvious field grasses. Unbelievable, I thought the people at Sweetwater sold out. I was WRONG. Solid, tasty DIPA, and hell yes its dank as f*ck IMO. Love it!

Poured from growler a hazy, medium golden amber, forming huge white head of foam. Aroma of pine, citrus & herbs. Flavour much of the same, however, a particular field grass taste came through in the end, which made it satisfactorily bitter. Not bad, recommend.

Poured from pint can a deep oily black, forming a nice beige head of foam. Aroma upfront with coffee, cocoa, hops, field grass and licorice. Flavour much of the same, creamy finish that is somewhat bitter yet smooth. Excellent, recommend.

Pours from bomber an incredible dark amber forming a nice white head of foam. Aroma pungent upfront, sweet caramel malt and a big-ass floral hops and field grasses. Flavour of peppery bitterness, sugary sweetness, finishes with an ultra aggressive level of more hop bitterness and a sticky sweet grainy finish. Superb and satisfying beer.
beer_name: Ballast Point Tongue Buckler Imperial Red Ale

review_blob: Pours from tap a bright hazy amber with a medium beige head that recedes slowly. Aroma of a little orange and peach, and a tiny bit of pine, but mostly grapefruit. Flavour of pine resin, grapefruit, earthy and floral hops. The beer left my palate medium bodied and perfect carbonation and a slick, oily mouthfeel that transitions nicely to the dry, bitter finish. Recommend.

Pours from tap a dark orange with a white head. Aroma of grapefruit and bready malts with a hint of field grass. Flavour was upfront bitter, with a pleasant floral sweetness to finish. Very clean. Fresh and flavourful, recommend.

Growler compliments of doboy (Thanks Eduardo). Poured pitch black, forming small light brown head of foam. Aroma of coffees, roasted barley, field grasses, wet earth and peat. Flavour of definitive coffees, burnt roasted nuts and barley with a particular milk chocolate finish.

Poured from tap a beautiful, hazy deep golden. Aroma strong from tulip, huge, flowery hops, Scottish field grass, tropical fruits, pine resin and rind. Flavour truly the same, finishes with huge piney bitterness. Excellent beer.
beer_name: Foothills IPA of the Month: December 2014 (Miss Elle Toe)

review_blob: Poured pitch black from tap, forming nice light brown head of foam. Aroma bitter hops, dark roasted barley, burnt chocolate, burnt hay and slight licorice. Flavour dark chocolate cherries, Scottish field grass and chalky, bitter chocolate, finishes smooth and creamy. Recommended.

Poured from 16 Oz can, golden hay color, forming craggy foamy head. Aroma of hops, malts, wet field grass. Flavor was of fresh, wet hops and field grass followed by a moderate maltiness. Noda really has it going on, easy drinking somewhat flavourful beer.

Poured from tap @ NoDa, a medium golden color, forming white foamy head. Aroma of hops, herbs, lite tropical fruits and biscuits yeast and field grass. 
Flavor pleasantly pungent, bitter hops, mango, yeasty rolls. Deliciously fresh and quaffable.
beer_name: NoDa Hop, Drop n Roll IPA

review_blob: Poured from tap @ brewery, black opaque, forming decent medium off beige head of foam. Aroma of bitter chocolates, roasted barley and nuts with a spicy hint. Flavor was much of the same, roasted barley and milk chocolate prevail. Delicious and quaffable.
beer_name: NoDa Top Shelf Series Imperial Coco Loco

review_blob: Pours from bomber a vibrant amber orange, forming a decent off white foamy head. Aroma full on tropical fruits, yeast, hops, field grass and slight malts. Flavour much of the same, ending in a sticky, sweet goodness Recommended.
beer_name: Evil Twin Molotov Cocktail Single Simcoe Hop Edition

review_blob: Pours from bomber a dark mahogany color with a ruby glow and an off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, roastiness, and molasses with a tinged of malts. Flavour of sour raspberries, roasted malts, sweet chocolate, hoppy field grass. Really reminded me of SAB. Pretty good.

Poured from bomber into goblet a dark ruby red, if not black in color. Formed decent medium beige, small foamy head. Aroma is of bakers chocolate, ocean and dark roasted malt. Flavour is of roasted malt, dark fruit and nuts, lightly salted. Bitter chocolate conveys through. Lighter body than expected.
beer_name: New Belgium / Perennial Lips of Faith - Salted Belgian Chocolate Stout

review_blob: Pours from 12 oz bottle a clear, pale yellow body with a white head. Aroma of citrusy and lightly spicy hop notes, great malt profile. Flavour of citrus fruits, some grass, tropical fruits, light toffee sweetness, and a bitter, grapefruit finish. Overall decent.
